subject: Music
title: Music and Anticipation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Music and Anticipation.

hook.text: The best part of your favorite song isn't the climax ‚Äî it's the moment right before.

buildup.text: Your brain starts releasing dopamine during the buildup ‚Äî before the drop even hits.

discovery.text: Composers have exploited this for centuries ‚Äî delaying resolution to maximize emotional payoff.

twist.text: The gap between expectation and delivery is where all musical emotion lives.

climax.text: That's why a pause before the final chorus hits harder than the chorus itself.

punchline.text: Music isn't about the notes. It's about the waiting.

quiz.question: When does dopamine release begin during music listening?
options: During the anticipation phase, before the musical climax
